result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R Storlien was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Counts 3, 4 & 8
Concurrent with: Count 2

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Von Maur to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision before costs or fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

No Contact with Jennifer Workman, Target and Von Maur. Inform agent of all prescriptions. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. 
No possession of financial documents or cards of another. No possession of ID Cards of another. No use of computer without prior agent approval. No use or possession of scanners or printers. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Court does not object to transfer to Minnesota if accepted.

Consecutive to: Counts 3, 4 & 8
Concurrent with: Count 1

records.addlTxt:
11:07 AM Defendant Jacob R Storlien in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Jacob R Storlien.  Attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1-4 and 8.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Counts 5-7 and 9 are Dismissed and read in.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court ordered the following: 
COUNT 1: 
IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

4  YEARS OF IMPRISONMENT (Credit:  0 Days)
2  YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
Concurrent to:  Count 2, but consecutive to Counts 3, 4, & 8; 

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  Court does not object to transfer to Minnesota if accepted; 
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed;
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  Jennifer Workman, Target, and Von Maur; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed;
*No use of possession of financial documents or cards of another; 
*No possession of ID cards of another; 
*No use of computer without prior agent approval;
*No use or possession of scanners and/or printing devices.

RESTITUTION:  $1,686.87 to Von Maur (Restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COSTS:  $268     
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250     
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
